content.description: The underside of some the granite is chunky crumbles otherwise, the surface it great. The crux is a semi roof move over a large flake 20 feet up. Great nut placements along with two #3 BDs and a #4 BD.
content.protection: Small to Large Nuts, Medium to large cams, tricams   Two bolt anchor, with rusted rap chains.
content.location: The second major vertical crack. Right leaning and wide at the base. Narrows to hands and then with horizontal ledges to the top. Rap off.

climbs.name: Greg and Al's Excellent Adventure
climbs.fa: Doug Fletcher & Jan Holdeman (TR)  Greg Opland & Al Muto 1/92

content.description: The base before the first bolt is super thin, with ground-fall potential. If you are at the second bolt and miss the clip, there is ground fall potential.   A direct start is harder then 5.9   If you use the left side of the flake to bypass a direct start, the route runs near grade.
content.protection: 3 bolts, two bolt anchor and rap chains
content.location: Just right of Fake Out Flake on the face.   Rap off.

content.description: Nice route shaded by the flake. A chockstone at the top stops the rope from running in the crack. A nice shaded belay location on Greg and Al's Excellent Adventure is a bonus.
content.protection: nuts, medium to large cams. Anchor at Palo Verde tree(higher) or stop at at Greg and Al's Excellent Adventure anchor.
content.location: The obvious wide crack in right facing corner. To a narrow crack at the top with some ledges on the face. Rap off Greg and Al's Excellent Adventure.

content.description:
Sleeping Cactus Wall is one of three crags down at the north end of Little Granite Mountain, on the east side. There are a good selection of moderate routes in Sleeping Cactus, from 5.6 up to 5.10a. The rock can be a little less than great in places, but it's not too bad for the most part. 

  I'm not sure these days if SCW sees much traffic, so you probably don't have to worry about sharing with other climbers. The best routes at the crag are Tupelo Honey (5.9+) and Chasm View (5.10a). A rap station with chains is located sort of dead center on the wall to get back down.
